column2: Our riches and influence prove that we are more than just a regular city, and we must proclaim it as such!
I can restore old Connecticut, one of the original Thirteen.
I can unite the Gardenian people under one flag.
Having united all the Springfields accross America, I can now form the Empire of Springfield!
We have recovered all the lands of Ousamequin's confederacy, and the time has come to proclaim a new Massasoit!
The time has come to unite the great Maritimes under one true crown of Acadia.
We must tear down the false Popes of Québec and bring back the true Church into the fold.
The time has come to unite the West and East kingdoms of old Pennsylvania under one crown.
New England has always stood as the mightiest region of old America, if not the most disunited as well. Now that the era of conflict is over, it is time to proclaim my rule over all of New England!
New York is by far the most prosperous and most powerful state of the old Thirteen, and with my rule over it cemented, it is time to proclaim a new empire worthy of rivaling even Columbia!
The five Great Lakes of America are the largest lakes in the wide world, and by uniting them we will rival empires the likes of Canada and America!
Virginia was once the largest state of old America, stretching from the Atlantic in the east to the Pacific in the west. It is time to reclaim our place in the Sun!

The High Kingdom of the Two Carolinas was one of the great early post-Event empires, a realm so powerful it rivaled Columbia for its entire existence. Though its glory days are behind us, a powerful enough ruler may be able to proclaim its restoration...
Maine was once the greatest state of New England, and though its legacy may be growing weak, a powerful enough ruler can proclaim its restoration.
We can proclaim a New Acadia in the lands of old America.
The time has come to unify the great cities of the East into a mighty empire once more!
The antedeluvian state of Louisiana has been divided between the Arkansans and the Caijuns for too long, let us restore its long-lost glories!
